item.title: TC add a quote by J. Maarten Troost
item.description: "Like many air travelers, I am aware that airplanes fly aided by capricious fairies and invisible strings." -- J. Maarten Troost

item.title: TC add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: TC add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: TC add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: TC add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: TC add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Anyone who says he can see through women is missing a lot." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: TC add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: TC add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Cultivate your curves - they may be dangerous but they won't be avoided." -- Mae West

item.title: TC add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often." -- Mae West

item.title: TC add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "He'd noticed that sex bore some resemblance to cookery: it fascinated people, they sometimes bought books full of complicated recipes and interesting pictures, and sometimes when they were really hungry they created vast banquets in their imagination - but at the end of the day they'd settle quite happily for egg and chips. If it was well done and maybe had a slice of tomato." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: TC add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: TC add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "How do I know you'll keep your word?" asked Coraline. "I swear it," said the other mother. "I swear it on my own mother's grave." "Does she have a grave?" asked Coraline. "Oh yes," said the other mother. "I put her in there myself. And when I found her trying to crawl out, I put her back." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: TC add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; itâ€™s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: TC add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Paranoid? Probably. But just because you're paranoid doesn't mean there isn't an invisible demon about to eat your face." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: TC add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell
